page.title: 13 TRANSPORT
page.content: Major road routes sculpture three sides of our grid.Along the western edge is the entire M275 Motorway.Ten years old, it has speeded the growth of Portsmouth's Continental Ferry services.It has literally paved the way for tidying up the Tipner side of the Harbour. The M275 links with the M27,and both were built on land reclaimed from the harbour mud-flats using the city's rubbish plus chalk from Portsdown Hill.From both roads the views are full of interest. Beneath the M27, Portsbridge round- about marks the original crossing into Portsmouth.With its huge bus depot and six major roads it is still a vital transport centre. Eastwards the M27 joins the Eastern Road, the dual-carriageway to Southsea.
